description: The walking tour will explore the showcase landscape and built environment of the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park and it's surroundings. The tour will showcase unique waterscapes in the area and talk about the importance of rainwater, water and sustainable urban design; its relation to public space and how water integration can shape and design spaces.

factsheet.heading: Tour
paragraphs: Throughout the centuries water has always designed the urban fabric. In this tour we'll see and talk about how water was a primary element in the construction of the public space along the East Village and the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park.

Along the tour we'll be seeing different (landscape) architectural solutions, resulting in a diversity of public space designs and and water features constituting an array of interconnected waterscapes.

factsheet.heading: Guide
paragraphs: Your guide will be an Urban Planner that has knows first-hand the kind of urban transformations like the East Village/Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, such as Barcelona's water front/Olympic Village (1992 Olympic Games) and Lisbon's water front/Parque das Nações (1998's World Expo).

factsheet.heading: Golden Key Academy
paragraphs: The tour will be led by an Open City’s Golden Key Academy student, and it's one of many other walking tours provided by them.

The Golden Key Academy is a public speaking course developing the essential skills, knowledge and critical thinking required to deliver engaging walking and cycling tours unlocking complex architecture, heritage, and urban issues.
More information on the Golden Key Academy can be found at https://open-city.org.uk/golden-key-academy

factsheet.heading: Getting prepared
paragraphs:
It's a walking tour in an open space so, please:
1. Arrive early so we can start on time (mind special events that can affect traffic flow, diverted traffic, public transport works or delays).
2. Dress accordingly to the weather, whether is sunny and hot or rainy (bring water and something for shade if it's hot).
3. Bring comfortable footwear.

name: Stratford's waterscapes
